```{r}
# Load required libraries
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(readr)
library(scales)

# ---- 1. Visualization: Bass model forecast for sales ----


sales_data <- read_csv("C:/Users/vl/OneDrive/Рабочий стол/HW data Marketing.csv")  


bass_model <- function(t, p, q, M) {
  M * ((1 - exp(-(p + q) * t)) / (1 + (q / p) * exp(-(p + q) * t)))
}

#
p <- 0.025
q <- 0.41
M <- 480  


years_forecast <- 2015:2035
pred_sales <- bass_model(years_forecast - 2015, p, q, M)

forecast_df <- data.frame(
  Year = years_forecast,
  Predicted_Sales = pred_sales
)

# Plot
ggplot() +
  geom_line(data = sales_data, aes(x = Year, y = US_Retail_Sales_Million_USD), color = "blue", size = 1.2) +
  geom_line(data = forecast_df, aes(x = Year, y = Predicted_Sales), color = "red", linetype = "dashed", size = 1.2) +
  labs(title = "Bass Model Forecast for Sales",
       x = "Year",
       y = "US_Retail_Sales_Million_USD",
       caption = "Blue: Actual Sales | Red Dashed: Bass Model Forecast") +
  theme_minimal()
```
